intro: Urginavia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered urginavia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
